entry.title: Forking personal "vanity" versions...
entry.summary: In an email conversation between Gregory Maxwell and Alan Grimes, the topic of vanity versions of bitcoin is discussed. Grimes argues that there can never be too many vanity versions of bitcoin, to which Maxwell responds by questioning whether there are any vanity versions that remove the use of libdb or require certain development headers not to be installed. The conversation ends with a humorous comment from JS about the possibility of magic build instructions in the readme file.
